390750.name: Fantasy Grounds - D&D Scourge of the Sword Coast
390750.description:
Dreams of the Red Wizards
Scourge of the Sword Coast is a D&D adventure designed for 2nd-level characters. This adventure is the first part of the Dreams of the Red Wizards campaign, which continues with the Dead in Thay adventure. Over the course of these two adventures, players can face off with major villains of the Forgotten Realms campaign setting.
* Disclaimer:This adventure was written before the release of the final fifth edition rules for Dungeons & Dragons. Wherever possible, it has been updated to reflect the latest rules. The original adventure also came with 3.5E and 4E versions of all the monsters and NPCs in the module. These are not being provided as part of this release. Only D&D fifth edition is currently supported.
"Dreams of the Red Wizards: Scourge of the Sword Coast" (2014), by Tito Leati, Matt Sernett, and Chris Sims, was the adventure for Season 17 of D&D Encounters.
This Module Includes:
  • the entire contents of Scourge of the Sword Coast adventure
  • image handouts that can be shared with players collectively or individually
  • maps containing information for the Dungeon Master (DM) only and with all locations pre-linked to story entries which may contain additional DM notes, boxed text, encounters, images and treasure parcels
  • maps with all hidden information removed and resized for use as tactical combat maps
  • tokens for many of the monsters in the module. When no token is available, a letter token is used to represent the NPC
  • XP for encounters that can be dragged to the party sheet and awarded to the players as they complete them
  • Searchable monster indexes by CR, type and in alphabetical order
Requirements: The 5E Ruleset
Recommended: D&D Basic Rules, D&D Player's Handbook or D&D Character Customization Pack, D&D Monster Manual
Adapted for Fantasy Grounds by: TASAgent
Requires: The free Fantasy Grounds virtual tabletop (VTT) software and the included D&D fifth edition ruleset.
Screenshots may differ from what you see in-game based on the extension and ruleset you have loaded.
